boardgame.name: Bios: Megafauna (Second Edition)
boardgame.description: Bios: Megafauna starts where the predecessor game Bios: Genesis left off, with the invasion of the land on the daybreak of the Phanerozoic eon. Starting as either a plant, mollusk, insect, or vertebral skeletal type, your flapping, paddling, and squawking carnivores and herbivores make a beachhead on one of the drifting continental plates in the Cambrian, Their struggle for terrestrial dominance may eventually include language-based consciousness. Although this achievement elevated a certain mammal species to notoriety, in your game things may occur differently._T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;This second edition of Bios: Megafauna is an evolutionary descendant of American Megafauna but as a part of the Bios series of games it is linked to the game Bios: Genesis. It plays well independently but if you have both games you can let the end state of a game of Bios: Genesis affect the starting state of a game of Bios: Megafauna. A successor game, called Bios: Origins (which would be a descendant of Origin), is planned to cover the events of the Quaternary period including the rise of ideas and technology._T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp;mdash;description from the publisher_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;
boardgame.boardgamepodcastepisode: Episode 116 -- The 2017 Essen Session With Heavy Cardboard

The second Bios game starts as life crawls/slithers/hops out of the sea and onto land. The environment is still hostile, though, and players_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_#039; creatures must evolve, expand and adapt as the climate and geography change. Hugely challenging, great fun and educational, too. The price shown is for UK/EU purchasers (and includes VAT). For purchasers outside the EU, the price is £45.00 (net of UK tax) - note that the purchaser is responsible for paying any duty or tax due on import to their country. I charge shipping at cost, as follows. UK addresses: £3.99 (myHermes, takes 2-3 working days, tracked) Other EU countries: £11.70 (Air mail, takes 1 week or so, not tracked) Europe outside the EU: £9.75 (Air mail, takes 1 week or so, not tracked) Australasia: £15.75 (Air mail, takes 1 week or so, not tracked) USA, Canada _T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp; elsewhere: £14.80 (Air mail, takes 1 week or so, not tracked)

Selling one copy of Bios:Megafauna (Second Edition). This copy of the game is unpunched and unplayed though the game box shows more than a bit of wear and tear. All components have been accounted (counters, wooden pieces, markers, cards and rules). Both card decks are unopened. The counters are unpunched. The Reservoir Placard is a bit convex at the moment, but I don_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_#039;t know if it came that way naturally. The game box has been beat up a bit. There are dings here and there along the game box edges. The lower left corner of the game box top has split along the small edge. In summary, the game contents are unpunched and unplayed. The game box has been beat up a bit.
